item.title: Covid in Sydney: Military deployed to help enforce lockdown
item.description: Authorities say the deployment is needed, but critics argue it will "pick on" marginalised groups.

item.title: Covid and a coup: The double crisis pushing Myanmar to the brink
item.description: A surge in virus cases has dealt a fresh blow to a country already dealing with military coup.

item.title: First group of evacuated Afghan interpreters to arrive in US
item.description: The evacuations are part of Operation Allies Refuge as the US military mission in Afghanistan ends.

item.title: China warns UK as carrier strike group approaches
item.description: A fleet of British ships is currently sailing through the South China Sea en route to Japan.

item.title: Hong Kong crowd booing China's anthem sparks police probe
item.description: Police are investigating an incident where hundreds jeered while watching an Olympics broadcast.

item.title: Didi: Chinese ride-hailing giant denies plans to go private
item.description: Didi shares surged by almost 50% in pre-market trade after a report that it planned to go private.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Three members of Australian athletics team isolating after close contact with Covid-19 case
item.description: Three members of the Australian athletics team remain in isolation after close contact with American pole vaulter Sam Kendricks, who has tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Afghanistan Taliban: Flash flooding kills dozens in remote province
item.description: At least 60 people die and many are missing in a remote area controlled by Islamist militants.

item.title: China interest in Afghanistan could be 'positive', says Blinken
item.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's comments came after Taliban envoys went on a visit to China.

item.title: Australia house prices soar at 'unsustainable' rate
item.description: Six state capitals have seen record prices for the third quarter in a row, the survey said.

item.title: Outspoken billionaire Sun Dawu jailed for 18 years in China
item.description: Sun Dawu has in the past been vocal in criticising authorities and has spoken out about human rights.

item.title: China expanding its nuclear capabilities, scientists say
item.description: It is building a site that will have extra capacity to store and launch missiles, scientists say.

item.title: Olympics: The hidden sight of Tokyo's homeless
item.description: For many among Tokyo's homeless community the Olympics are far from a cause for celebration.

item.title: Kris Wu: Why a superstar sparked China's sexual consent debate
item.description: A growing rape allegation controversy centering on Kris Wu has renewed discussion on sexual consent.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Does Japan have Covid under control?
item.description: With the Olympics underway, more Covid cases continue to be reported at the Games and across Japan.

item.title: Mapping the advance of the Taliban in Afghanistan
item.description: Maps of Afghanistan show who controls districts in fighting between the government and Taliban forces.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Take a tour of the incredible venues
item.description: They range from an arena built by a father and son, to a legendary home of Japanese martial arts.

item.title: Archibald Prize: 100 years of Australia's top portrait honour
item.description: Over 100 years, the Archibald Prize has become better at reflecting Australian diversity.

item.title: The Indian girl killed for wearing jeans
item.description: Neha Paswan was allegedly beaten to death by relatives who disagreed with her choice of clothes.

item.title: Sandstorm swallows city in northwestern China
item.description: Dust clouds towered at least 100 metres (330ft) over Dunhuang.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: One athlete braved sharks and crocodiles
item.description: Training for the Olympics can be a full-time job but Jo Brigden-Jones has combined it with much more.

item.title: Afrobeats in Japan: British-Nigerian hip hop dancer teaching children how to dance
item.description: Yinka Oshiletu, a British-Nigerian hip hop dancer is bringing Afrobeats sounds to Japan's young dancers.

item.title: Why is the Great Barrier Reef in trouble? A simple guide
item.description: Australia's natural wonder faces a battle to survive - here's a simple guide.
